adjectives.description: blueberry (comparative more blueberry, superlative most blueberry)

entries.meaning: (countable) An edible round berry, belonging to the cowberry group (Vaccinium sect. Cyanococcus), with flared crowns at the end, that turns blue on ripening.
(countable) The shrub of the above-mentioned berry.
(countable and uncountable) A dark blue colour.

verbs.description: blueberry (third-person singular simple present blueberries, present participle blueberrying, simple past and past participle blueberried)

entries.meaning: To gather or forage for blueberries.
examples: We blueberried on an open flat beside the river. The ground was covered with great frosted blue globules, sweet and warm in the sunshine.
